quest.name: Corpse Groom
journal: Paiyo Reiyo looks as though he has seen a ghost.

Paiyo Reiyo has received a wedding invitation from a former adventuring comrade, a lass named Edda with whom you are acquainted. While impending matrimonial festivities would ordinarily be a cause for gladness, the fact that the groom-to-be is no longer among the living has left the Lalafell deeply perturbed. Paiyo Reiyo indicates that he means to consult a former comrade and fellow invitee regarding the strange affair, only to learn from you that she, too, has been dead for some time. Racked by uncertainty, he requests to see Liavinne's grave with his own eyes. Meet Paiyo Reiyo at the Church of Saint Adama Landama, and show him where your fellow Scion was laid to rest.

Arriving at the lichyard, Paiyo Reiyo is dismayed to find Liavinne's grave despoiled and her body missing. He believes that Edda is the one responsible, having lost her battle with despair in the aftermath of her fiancé's death. The Lalafell departs for the Tam–Tara Deepcroft forthwith, determined to put an end to whatever madness his erstwhile comrade is about to commit. Given Edda's admiration for you, it seems likely that your presence will prove valuable to this endeavor. Make your own way to the Deepcroft, and speak with the Wood Wailer guarding the entrance.

Huguemont informs you that a Lalafell fitting Paiyo Reiyo's description recently entered the Deepcroft, and in the company of a maiden garbed all in white. Venture into the crypt, and aid Paiyo Reiyo in ending Edda's madness.

※The Tam–Tara Deepcroft (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Within the depths of Tam–Tara, you come face-to-face with Edda, and succeed in thwarting her dark ritual. Her plummet into the abyss is a sight you will not soon forget. Turn your attention now to Paiyo Reiyo, and see how he has weathered the ordeal.

With the unsavory affair put to rest, Paiyo Reiyo reveals that he has lost the will to continue adventuring. Before he is able to finish speaking, however, he abruptly breaks into a flurry of apologies, and flees like a man possessed. It would seem the Lalafell's troubles are not yet over...
objectives: Examine Liavinne's grave at the Church of Saint Adama Landama.
Speak with Huguemont at the Tam–Tara Deepcroft.
Speak with Paiyo Reiyo at the Tam–Tara Deepcroft.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Uwaaah!

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: ...Huh? Why, you're Forename Surname, the famous adventurer! Thank the gods for bringing you here!

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Paiyo Reiyo─one of the many faceless adventurers struggling to make their way in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Forgive me if I sound bitter. I don't begrudge you your renown. Your superiority as an adventurer was obvious to me long before you became a household name. Our paths crossed near Sastasha, you see. Hard to believe we moved in similar circles back then...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, do you perchance remember having met a conjurer named Edda around that time? We used to adventure together, she and I and two others.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Our little group didn't last very long, though. Things fell to pieces when Avere, our leader and Edda's fiancé, met his end in the Tam–Tara Deepcroft.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Harsh words were exchanged, and we all went our separate ways. Since then, I've been getting by on my own.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I hadn't planned on seeing any of my former comrades again, but then this letter arrived from Edda, containing an invitation to her wedding...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Now, I know what you're thinking: I should be happy for her. And I was...until I noticed the name of her groom–to–be. It was none other than Avere.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: What's more, the venue for the ceremony is to be the Tam–Tara Deepcroft, the very place the poor fellow died! Something isn't right, I tell you.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Now, in the letter, Edda wrote that Liavinne─that's the fourth member of our group─had already agreed to attend. They chanced to meet each other recently, from what I could gather.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Not knowing what to make of it all, I thought it wise to consult Liavinne about the whole strange affair before replying. But last I heard, she'd joined the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, and I didn't have the first idea how to go about tracking her down... Not until the greatest Scion of them all appeared, that is. Could you tell me where I might find her?

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: ...In the lichyard of the Church of Saint Adama Landama? I-I'm sorry, I don't─ Slain in an imperial raid, you say...? By the Twelve, I had no idea...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: When did this happen? ...While the Black Wolf still lived? Then...how can it be that Liavinne met Edda recently? Gods, I don't know what to believe...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: If it isn't too much to ask, I would be most grateful if you'd show me Liavinne's grave. We didn't always see eye to eye, but she had a good heart, and if she's truly... <sniff> Well, I need to pay my respects. Please, meet me at the lichyard.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: I'd be much obliged if you could show me Liavinne's grave. Please meet me at the Church of Saint Adama Landama, at the lichyard.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The tombstone has been knocked over, and the earth before it disturbed.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: So this is where poor Liavinne now lies...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: <gasp> Wh-What's the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Not only is her grave defiled─her body's gone! Who could have done this!?

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Oh, no... Could it have been...Edda? The more I think about it, the more it makes... Well, I was going to say “sense,” but... Gods...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: I will try to explain. To the rest of us, our little party of four was but a means to riches and glory─such things as adventurers seek. But to Edda, it was her life...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: She blamed herself for Avere's death, and to our shame, we agreed with her─though we knew full well we were all to blame. And then we left her where she stood with her fiancé's head for company...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Ack! How could we have been so heartless!? Small wonder if the poor girl has been driven from her wits!

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: <sigh> But what's done is done. All we can do is admit to our mistakes and make amends as best we can.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Avere is gone, and so is Liavinne, but Edda refuses to accept it. She won't let go of the past.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: I know not what she means to do in Tam–Tara, but it can lead to no good end.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: I will attend this...this wedding, and try to restore her to her senses.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: I would be much reassured if you could accompany me, Forename. As Avere once did, so too does Edda look up to you. She may not listen to me, but she may yet heed the words of someone she admires. And failing that...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: No. No, it doesn't bear thinking about. If we hurry, it need not come to that. Please meet me at the Tam–Tara Deepcroft. Together, we'll put an end to whatever madness Edda is planning.

dialogue.name: HUGUEMONT
dialogue.text: A Lalafellin thaumaturge? Just so happens a fellow like that went into the Deepcroft not a minute ago. There was a young lady with him, dressed head to toe in white.

dialogue.name: HUGUEMONT
dialogue.text: The lass was all smiles and giggles, like a maiden on her wedding day, but your friend looked stiff as a board. Can't say I blame him, though. Crypts do strange things to the best of us.

dialogue.name: HUGUEMONT
dialogue.text: You mean to head inside as well, do you? Well, take care you don't wake the dead, eh? Hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: HUGUEMONT
dialogue.text: You mean to head inside as well, do you? Well, take care you don't wake the dead, eh? Hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: It's finally over. Would that it could have been different...but what choice did we have?

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Let this be my last act as an adventurer. I've done quite enough harm as it is. I mean to go home and live out my days in─ Huh?

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: N-No... It...it can't be...

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: Uwaaaaaaaaah!!! I'm sorry! Please forgive meeeeeeeee!
